meanings.definition: Causing difficulty or discomfort; embarrassing or inconvenient.
meanings.sent1: The awkward situation made everyone feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: It was awkward when he tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: She felt awkward wearing mismatched socks to the party.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was as awkward as a penguin trying to fly.
meanings.sent5: The awkward conversation replayed in her mind all night.

meanings.definition: A feeling of embarrassment or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: His awkward was visible to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her awkward during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The awkward of being late to the meeting was palpable.
meanings.sent4: The awkward hung in the air like a heavy fog.
meanings.sent5: The awkward in the room was thick enough to cut with a knife.

meanings.definition: To behave in a socially awkward or uncomfortable manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to awk around new people.
meanings.sent2: She awked her way through the party, unsure of what to say.
meanings.sent3: They awked through the conversation, trying to avoid eye contact.
meanings.sent4: The team awked their way through the team-building exercise.
meanings.sent5: Awking in social situations can be challenging for some people.
